fields.label: Describe the condition of the dressing in relation to bleeding

fields.toaster_info_text:
- Instruct the client to come 2 days (48 hours) after surgery to remove dressing, if there is no bleeding or oozing, and day 7 for follow up
- Wear dried, clean, loose-fitting underwear, which should be changed each day	
- Shower twice a day after dressing removal, taking care to wash the genital area with soap and water gently
- Not applying any home remedies to surgical wound e.g. cow dung manure  Client/parent/guardian understands the signs of an emergency;
-- Increasing bleeding
-- Severe pain in the penis or genital area
-- Inability to pass urine or severe pain when passing urine
-- Pus discharging from the surgical wound,
-- Increasing swelling

Ensure that the client/parent/guardian:

- Understands that he/she should return to the nearby health facility immediately or seek emergency care if a problem develops
- Knows where to go if and when complications arise
- Has been given written postoperative instructions and has been asked to repeat them
- Ensure that the client/parent/guardian:
- Has been given medications as ordered
- Has been given a follow-up appointment
- Has a responsible adult to accompany him home (this is  for underage clients)

The provider should ensure that the client:

- Has been confirmed to be discharged by the operating surgeon or his/her designee
- The record has been completed and maintained at the health facility where the procedure took place
- The site should retain a copy of the referral note in case the client is transferred to another site

fields.label: Device Male Circumcision, Observe the following

fields.toaster_info_text:
Do not attempt to remove or try to reposition ShangRingTM 
Come back at day 7 after ShangRingTM placement for assessment and device removal 
Bath at least twice a day (If you sweat heavily, be sure to clean and dry your body immediately, to keep the wound from becoming infected, which would delay healing) 
Wash the circumcised area with clean water after urination and dry the area afterward 
Drink adequate amount of water to reduce inevitable occasion of erection 
Return to the facility accompanied by parent/guardian for client below 18 years 

Ensure that the client/parent/guardian:

- Understands that he/she should return to the nearby health facility immediately or seek emergency care if a problem develops
- Knows where to go if and when complications arise
